meanings.definition: A Scottish word meaning 'to go' or 'to move'.
meanings.sent1: The gane of the river was swift and steady.
meanings.sent2: She watched the gane of the clouds across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The gane of the turtle towards the water was slow but determined.
meanings.sent4: The gane of time never stops, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The gane of the train through the tunnel was loud and exciting.

meanings.definition: A Scottish word meaning 'to gain' or 'to acquire'.
meanings.sent1: His hard work led to the gane of new skills.
meanings.sent2: The gane of knowledge is a lifelong journey.
meanings.sent3: The gane of a new friend brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The gane of trust takes time and effort to build.
meanings.sent5: The gane of experience is invaluable in life.

meanings.definition: A Scottish word meaning 'to play' or 'to engage in a game'.
meanings.sent1: Children enjoy the gane of hide and seek.
meanings.sent2: The gane of chess requires strategic thinking.
meanings.sent3: The gane of tag in the park always brings laughter.
meanings.sent4: The gane of soccer can be both fun and competitive.
meanings.sent5: The gane of charades is a great way to bond with friends.
